historical:
Emergency Act Amendments

For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 4 of Capital Access Program Emergency Act of 2010 (D.C. Act 18-598, November 17, 2010, 57 DCR 11018).

For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 4 of Capital Access Program Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2011 (D.C. Act 19-6, February 11, 2011, 58 DCR 1408).

Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 18-322, see notes under § 2-1210.01.

DC CODE § 2-1210.03

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: There is established the Capital Access Program, to be administered by the Mayor, to assist financial institutions in making loans to businesses and nonprofit organizations that face barriers in accessing capital.

The Mayor shall determine the eligibility of a financial institution to participate in the program and, by rule, may set a limit on the number of financial institutions that may participate in the program.

subchapter.text: Access to Capital for Businesses and Nonprofit Organizations.
